The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:
Orbia will conduct its operations in an environmentally responsible manner that is protective of the communities in which we operate.  Our environmental management system assures compliance with applicable environmental laws and regulations.

We are committed to the continual improvement of environmental programs and to pollution prevention.  Setting and periodically reviewing environmental objectives and targets assures excellence in environmental leadership and product stewardship.

It is the responsibility of each and every one of us to ensure that all operations in the company are carried out in accordance with this policy.

Orbia believes safety and health are the highest corporate priority.  It is our policy to conduct business in a manner that ensures the safety and health of employees, customers and the communities in which we operate.

Orbia will be the leader in safety and health by setting aggressive goals and measuring performance.  We have adopted Responsible Care® principles to guide our efforts in continuous improvement.

It is Orbia's expectation that stakeholders be committed to operating in a safe manner.  As a condition of employment, we expect and require each individual to work safely at all times.  We must share the philosophy that every accident and injury is preventable.

It is the responsibility of each person at Orbia to give the highest priority to safety and health both on and off the job.  Commitment, attitude and behavior are the most important factors in preventing injuries and illnesses and preserving health.  Our commitment to excellence in safety and health is absolute.
The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:
The Orbia facility uses and stores vinyl chloride (VCM) in quantities greater than the RMP threshold of 10,000 lbs. VCM is received via rail car and stored in a storage tank for u

se on site. There are no other RMP regulated chemicals on site meeting the TQ under the RMP Rule.
The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:
Orbia has in place a prevention program encompassing elements consistent with the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management Standard(PSM) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR 1910.119) VCM, the same substance is regulated under the USEPA Clean Air Act (Section1 12(r)(7) Accidental Release Prevention Requirements: Risk Management Programs(RMP)( 40 CFR Part 68). 

The Orbia facility which is covered under the PSM and RMP standards has implemented the following:	

1. An Employee Participation policy has been instituted to regularly consult with employees regarding the development and implementation of PSM/RMP elements and hazard assessments.
 
2. A comprehensive Process Safety Information program which insures complete and accurate written information concerning process chemicals, process technology and process equipment. This information is included in the employee training programs. 

3. Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) is conducted to identify and analyze the potential hazards associated with the processing or handling of highly hazardous chemicals.

4. Written Operating Procedures are maintained, which describe tasks to be performed by operations, operating conditions to be maintained, data to be recorded, and safety precautions to be taken. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations and normal shutdown. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.

5. Orbia has established Employee Training programs to ensure that all employees, including maintenance and contractor employees involved with chemicals fully understand the potential hazards of each chemical.

MEXICHEM Corporation has established an "Operator Certification" program to train, test and certify company employees. Refresher training is provided at least every three years and more frequently as needed.

6. Contractors are thoroughly evaluated to ensure that they have the appropriate job skills, knowledge and certifications to perform the job safely. 

7. For new processes, a Pre Startup Safety review is conducted to insure a safe transition into the normal operating mode and to insure modifications to existing processes and procedures were constructed appropriately for a safe startup and operation.

8. A Mechanical Integrity program is in place to assure the integrity of process equipment. Elements include the following: 

-	Identification and categorization of equipment 
-	Inspections and tests
-	Establishment of prescribed inspection frequencies 
-	Development and application of pertinent maintenance procedures 
-	Training of maintenance personnel 
-	Documentation of test and inspection results 

 9. A "Hot Work" Permit system is in place to manage welding, cutting, brazing or spark producing operations in process areas. 

10. To properly manage changes involving processes, chemicals, technology, equipment or facilities a Management of Change system has been implemented. 

11. In the event of any chemical release or "near miss" an Incident Investigation is conducted by a team of experienced individual's familiar with the process. Any recommendations are documented within the Management of Change system. 

12. An Emergency Response program is in place for the entire facility and the surrounding community in the event of a chemical release. 

13. Compliance Audits are performed to review all relevant documentation, verify process safety information, inspect the physical facilities and conduct interviews with representative plant personnel.
The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:
During the past five years Orbia has had no chemical releases which cr

eated an emergency situation outside the plant boundaries nor resulted in any deaths injuries, or significant property damage on site or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.
The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:
In the event of an emergency, Orbia has an emergency action plan in place. A notification system is in place to initiate response to any emergency such as evacuations, adequate first aid, and notification of local emergency response agencies. The facility is considered a non-responding facility and coordinates with the Avon Lake Fire Department and the Local Emergency Planning Committee(LEPC) to insure good communication and operational effectiveness for response to an accidental chemical release.
Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:
Orbia plans to continue to evaluate the regulated process as required under the PSM/RMP Standards to insure safe operations. Orbia annually performs a complete facility review to verify an effective Environmental, Safety and Health program.
